headline: T-Mobile US (TMUS) Launches Feature-Packed Revvl 8 Smartphone With Exclusive Offers
summary: T-Mobile US (TMUS) recently launched the Revvl 8 smartphone, adding advanced features at competitive pricing to its lineup, and introduced benefits for new and existing customers, which aligns with its strategic focus on providing value. Over the past month, the company's share price rose 9%, possibly supported by these product advancements and promotional offers. This uptick occurred alongside a broader market rally, driven by expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut, which lifted indices...

headline: T-Mobile Introduces New Revvl 8 Smartphone Packed with Power and Perks
summary: BELLEVUE, Wash., August 12, 2025--What’s the News: Today, T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS) introduced the all-new T-Mobile Revvl 8 smartphone — the latest addition in its Revvl lineup, which also includes the Revvl Tab 2 — now available at T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. With performance and features on par with pricier smartphones on top of benefit-packed plans on America’s Best Mobile Network, Revvl 8 is a standout value. The new Revvl 8 will be available in stores and online Thu., Aug. 14 exclusively

With performance and features on par with pricier smartphones on top of benefit-packed plans on America’s Best Mobile Network, Revvl 8 is a standout value. The new Revvl 8 will be available in stores and online Thu., Aug. 14 exclusively

headline: TDS Q2 Deep Dive: Portfolio Reshaping and Fiber Expansion Set the Stage for Transformation
summary: Telecommunications services provider Telephone and Data Systems (NYSE:TDS) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 4.2% year on year to $1.19 billion. Its GAAP loss of $0.05 per share was significantly below analysts’ consensus estimates.

Its GAAP loss of $0.05 per share was significantly below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: USM Q2 Deep Dive: T-Mobile Sale Reshapes Strategy, Fiber and Towers in Focus
summary: Wireless telecommunications provider U.S. Cellular (NYSE:USM) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q2 CY2025, but sales fell by 1.2% year on year to $916 million. Its GAAP profit of $0.35 per share was 5.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
